io.branch.referral

Class ApkParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.branch.referral.ApkParser

  • public class ApkParser
extends java.lang.Object
    ApkParser

    Parses the 'compressed' binary form of Android XML docs, such as AndroidManifest.xml, that are contained within an APK file.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int endDocTag
      A static Integer that is used to identify the end of a compressed XML document.
      static int endTag
      A static Integer that is used to identify the end of a XML tag within a compressed XML document.
      static int startTag
      A static Integer that is used to identify the start of a XML tag within a compressed XML document.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ApkParser()

      Get a String of the value stored in StringTable format at offset strOff, as calculated from an initial starting point and a number of words to traverse.
      java.lang.String compXmlStringAt(byte[] arr, int strOff)
      Get a String of the value stored in StringTable format at offset strOff.
      java.lang.String decompressXML(byte[] xml)
      Gets the result of decompression of AndroidManifest.xml from within an APK, as a String, based on an input byte array parameter.
      int LEW(byte[] arr, int off)
      Gets the LEW (Little-Endian Word) from a Byte array, at the position defined by the offset Integer provided.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ApkParser

    • Method Detail

      • decompressXML

        public java.lang.String decompressXML(byte[] xml)

        Gets the result of decompression of AndroidManifest.xml from within an APK, as a String, based on an input byte array parameter.

        The SystemObserver.getURIScheme() method outputs the required Byte array, so can be used as a parameter for this method, for instance by using the following code in an Activity Context:

         SystemObserver systemObserver = new SystemObserver(this);      // "this" being an Activity in this case
 
 String manifestStr = decompressXML(systemObserver.getURIScheme());
        Parameters:
        xml - A Byte[] containing the XML to be decompressed.
        Returns:
        A String containing the result of the decompression action.

      • compXmlString

        public java.lang.String compXmlString(byte[] xml,
                                      int sitOff,
                                      int stOff,
                                      int strInd)

        Get a String of the value stored in StringTable format at offset strOff, as calculated from an initial starting point and a number of words to traverse.

        Parameters:
        xml - The Byte array to be processed.
        sitOff - An Integer value indicating the initial offset within the supplied Byte array.
        stOff - An Integer value indicating the initial offset of the supplied array.
        strInd - An Integer value indicating the string index to use in the LEW calculation.
        Returns:
        A call to compXmlStringAt(byte[],int), with the result of the offset calculation of this method as the Integer parameter.

      • compXmlStringAt

        public java.lang.String compXmlStringAt(byte[] arr,
                                        int strOff)

        Get a String of the value stored in StringTable format at offset strOff. This offset points to the 16 bit string length, which is followed by that number of 16 bit (Unicode) chars.

        Parameters:
        arr - The Byte array to be processed.
        strOff - An Integer denoting the offset within the array to fetch result from.
        Returns:
        A String value at the offset specified in parameter strOff.

      • LEW

        public int LEW(byte[] arr,
               int off)
        Gets the LEW (Little-Endian Word) from a Byte array, at the position defined by the offset Integer provided.
        Parameters:
        arr - The Byte array to process.
        off - An int value indicating the offset from which the return value should be taken.
        Returns:
        The Integer Little Endian 32 bit word taken from the input Byte array at the offset supplied as a parameter.
